companydescription:
SMEY is an AI-enabled techbio company developing sustainable cultivated oils and fats through precision fermentation. Headquartered in Paris, France, with an R&D center in Munich, Germany, we leverage NOY ‚Äî the world‚Äôs first Neobank of Yeasts, a physical and digital library of over 1,000 non-GMO species that gives direct access to new and sustainable oils and unique enzymes.
We are setting a new benchmark for high-performance, traceable, and climate-resilient ingredients in the food and cosmetics industries. Our flagship products, Noyl Silk (cHOO), a cultivated High-Oleic Oil designed for cosmetic applications, and Noyl Cocoa (cCB), a cultivated Cocoa Butter for food, exemplify this standard of performance and sustainability.

Noyl Silk defines a new category of designed oils, with a unique fatty acid profile that delivers superior stability and sensorial excellence. Noyl Cocoa provides a sustainable, functionally equivalent alternative to cocoa butter, helping brands avoid the ethical and environmental trade-offs of tropical sourcing.

Produced without farmland, using minimal water, and with zero deforestation impact, SMEY‚Äôs cultivated oils empower global brands to meet clean-label and EUDR requirements while building transparent, future-proof supply chains.

tagline:
Global futurist / Keynote speaker / Head of proGective, Gaming the Future, Fondation 2100 /
PhD in foresight
summary:
Foresight is not only about exploring new grounds, empowering people through concertation, collaboration and visioning, and concretely shaping, even building the future... In a VUCA time, it is about making sense of the fireworks of trends, emergences, breakthroughs and ruptures that are blurring our understanding of the Big Picture. 
Official Bio:
Fabienne GOUX-BAUDIMENT earned a Masters in Political Science (France) and a PhD in Human and Social Foresight (Social Sciences, Roma, Italy). Futurist, she has been the founding head of the consulting firm proGective in France (Paris) since 1994; centre of application, research and training in futures studies, proGective meets its clients' needs (either central or local governments, businesses, NGOs) by working out innovative and foresight-oriented solutions. 
She has been Associate Professor of Foresight and Innovation, and coordinator of the curriculum "Knowledge Engineer" at the University of Angers (1995-2018). She served as a member of the Foresight section of the Regional Economic, Social and Environmental Council of Ile de France (2014-2018).
Former president of the World Futures Studies Federation (2005-2009), she is a founding member of the French Society for Foresight which she chaired from 2013 to 2016.
Author and referee of several international Journals, Fabienne is also a member of the Association of Professional Futurists and a Fellow of the World Futures Studies Federation. 
-----------
Books always on my shelf:
- MacFarlane, Alan. Letters To Lily: On how the world works. New Ed. London: Profile Books, 2010.
- Baldwin, David A. Economic Statecraft. Princeton, NJ: Princeton University Press, 1985.
- Machiavelli, Niccolo. Il Principe Di Niccol√≤ Machiavelli. Franklin Classics, 2018.

DILA is responsible for publishing laws and decrees in the Journal Officiel de la R√©publique fran√ßaise (#JORF). It publishes and disseminates French legislative and regulatory texts on the L√©gifrance.gouv.fr legal access website. 
It publishes all legal, economic and financial information relating to public contracts, business life and associations (BODACC//BOAMP/BALO).

- ADMINISTRATIVE INFORMATION (individuals and companies)
DILA is the publisher of the official French administration website, service-public.fr and its professional version entreprendre.service-public.fr

- PUBLIC DEBATE & PUBLISHING
With the editions of La Documentation fran√ßaise, DILA is the preferred partner of more than 100 administrations and organisations. It also offers printing services to administrations.
A free information site on public life and current public debate, vie-publique.fr offers the keys to understanding public policies and the major debates that drive society.

- 659 million visits to all DILA sites

summary:
Results and actions driven, insight driven and analytical thinker, my track record includes multiple product management and strategy positions.  I have 12+ years of experience in product management, gained through working with North American high-tech software companies in France and as an expatriate in the United States and Germany. Over the years, I progressed from Product Manager to Head of Product.

My experience spans:
‚óè Company types: Large corporations (AT&T, Lucent Technologies, Nortel, Alcatel, Orange) as well as startups (Cloudwatt, Wallix) and even a unicorn (Shift).
‚óè Industries: Cloud computing, SaaS, open-source applications, mobile telecom, telecom network APIs, cybersecurity, and AI/ML.
‚óè Development methodologies: Both waterfall models with long release cycles and agile frameworks, including Scrum and Kanban.

I have expertise in all three pillars of product management:
‚óè Strategy: Defining strategic vision, analyzing addressable markets and competition, drafting Strategic Requirement Documents, managing budget and costs, applying Blue Ocean strategy, building business cases, structuring governance, and designing strategic roadmaps.
‚óè Execution: Prioritizing backlogs, defining product roadmaps, writing specifications (epics, stories), designing interfaces, and delivering demos.
‚óè Go-to-Market & Growth: Defining sales and channel strategies, crafting product positioning and messaging, creating marketing assets (brochures, product descriptions), drafting contracts (online, OEM, business contribution), setting pricing strategies, evangelizing products, and training sales teams.

In 2020, I founded my own consulting firm, providing product management services, delivering conferences‚Äîincluding one with an audience of 388 people online‚Äîand offering training and coaching for startup founders, executives, and product managers seeking an external perspective.

Today, I am looking to rejoin a corporate environment in a leadership role as a Head of Product or Product Director where I can drive product strategy and execution at scale.

tagline: Product Manager || Product + AI, Data || I help B2B SaaS teams turn AI PoCs into scalable, productized features that customers actually use and pay for
summary:
Over the past 6 years, I've built and shipped AI products that generated $30M+ in new recurring revenue across companies from startups to NASDAQ-traded enterprises.

I've been in your shoes: 

Sitting on valuable data but struggling to turn it into defensible products. 
Watching competitors ship AI features while your team debates strategy decks. 
Managing engineering teams excited about the latest models but unclear on business impact.


At Clustree and Cornerstone, I drove $30M+ ARR in new AI product initiatives while managing cross-functional teams of AI/ML engineers, data scientists, and product managers, serving millions of active users daily.

Across 13+ years in tech, I shipped products as both software engineer and product manager across nearly every type of B2B company:

Pre-market-fit startup? ‚úÖ
Fast-scaling SaaS scaleup? ‚úÖ
AI startup acquihired? ‚úÖ
NASDAQ-traded Silicon Valley company? ‚úÖ

Along the way, I launched my own company, mentored dozens of engineers and PMs, and advised several founders navigating growth and transformation.

Now, in 2025, I help scaling tech companies turn their AI confusion into shipped products that actually move the business.

My clients don't want another "AI initiative." They want someone who's navigated the gap between AI potential and product reality, someone who can turn their company's unique advantages into something shippable, defensible, and useful.

Here's what I bring:
* Strategic clarity on what to build (and what to skip)
* Org enablement to align product, data, and AI teams
* Hands-on product leadership from someone who's actually shipped

If you're leading a sharp team but still:
* Feel like your AI roadmap is a deck, not a plan
* Sit on valuable data but don't know how to unlock it
* Watch competitors ship while you're stuck in thinking mode

You're not behind. You're just missing the link between tech potential and product reality.

Ready to move from AI experiments to AI revenue?
DM on LinkedIn or Email: jeremy@rollrollrepeat.com 

I also run a weekly newsletter for practical AI product insights: https://rollrollai.com

I am adamant that my wealth of experiences and encounters have propelled me all through my life.

The chances and opportunities offered by my parents allowed me to spend many academic years abroad, 3 in the United Kingdom followed closely by two in Munich, Germany before graduating High School.

This inflated my perspectives and allowed me to meet countless amazing acquaintances and friends from far reaching horizons.

I have strived to grasp every occasion put forward and this constituted the foundation for the rich and diverse background of involvement in domains like communication, service, real estate, art, luxury retail, software, translation and bookkeeping. 

I hope to furnish this portofolio even more in the coming years by adding data science and business management to list. I aspire to work in the financial industry in the foreseeable future.

Soft skills including communication and emotional intelligence have been some of the most rewarding tools I picked up from my work experiences, social interactions, and academic life. Furthermore they enticed my rhetorical capabilities, transformed my self-confidence; I feel adamant that my public speaking, leadership abilities, and team collaborations skills are nurtured by exposure to hackathons and group projects.

In a similar register language acquisition has been a long time hobby of mine, resulting in myself being fluent in English, French and German, proficient in Spanish, and conversational in Italian and Japanese. companydescription:
NamSor software classifies personal names accurately by gender, country of origin, or ethnicity. 

Our mission is to make sense of the Big Data and help understand international flows of money, ideas and people. Our specialized data mining software recognizes the linguistic or cultural origin of personal names in any alphabet / language, with fine grain and high accuracy. Names are meaningful : we use sociolinguistics to extract their semantics and deliver actionable intelligence. 

We apply this innovative technology to support our clients in their development : countries, regions, private companies, projects, in all sectors of activity. NamSor API Key unlocks the value of diversity.

We support public and private Diaspora marketing and engagement programs, for human development and economic growth.

companydescription:
At Albert School, the premier data-driven business school, we aim not just to prepare students for their careers but to train talents poised to make a significant difference.

We offer two programmes of excellence in collaboration with Mines de Paris:

A Bachelor's degree in Business & Data, a three-year program leading to a double degree from Albert School and Mines de Paris (equivalent to a bachelor's degree).
Four Master of Science (MSc) programmes, each a two-year course culminating in double degrees from Albert School and Mines de Paris (equivalent to a master's degree).
Applications for these programmes are now open online, with direct applications for our post-baccalaureate programme outside the Parcoursup system.

Situated in Paris, Lyon, and Marseille, the school provides an unparalleled blend of academic and professional training in business and data. Our pedagogy is rooted in practical experience, offering 'business deep dives': intensive three-week projects tackling real-world business cases in collaboration with top companies, startups, and unicorns. Teaching excellence is assured by faculty and guest speakers from prestigious institutions (√âcole Polytechnique, HEC, Sciences Po) and the business sector. Our curriculum, endorsed by CEOs like Xavier Niel and Bernard Arnault, is co-developed with our corporate partners, paving the way for opportunities with leading firms such as LVMH, Blackrock and BCG.

A data-driven approach informs both our learning methodologies and the tools provided to students. We emphasize balance and personal fulfilment, encouraging student-led projects and offering two hours of personalized guidance weekly.

tagline: VP, Marketing at Skaleet
summary:
As a kid, I grew up watching tech wiggle its way into our household and change life as we knew it. I was fascinated. Whether it was the many hours I spent trying to beat my brothers on Nintendo‚Äôs Track Meet and Duck Hunt (anyone?) or later burning CD‚Äôs at home and selling them to my neighborhood ‚Äúcustomers‚Äù, I was hooked.

Fast forward several years, I started my career off in cyber security and systems engineering, hopped over to venture capital investing in digital media and healthtech, then switched sides of the table and have been in startup/scaleup-land the past +10 years helping companies at various stages find product-market fit, grow revenue through sustainable inbound, outbound, and product-led growth strategies, and successfully launch new markets. I've worked boots on-the-ground across 20 countries and five continents, most recently spending a lot of time in fintech, blockchain and SaaS. Digesting complex challenges, finding scalable formulas to penetrate and grow, and implementing strategies across regional and cultural lines has been nothing but exhilarating. 

On the side, I‚Äôm passionate about both personal finance and enabling exposure and access for girls and young women in STEM. These are spaces that have been core to my experience and for so many, are huge barriers to overcome. I work with nonprofits in these areas in strategic and advisory capacities. 

Happy to connect on all things tech, non-profit advisory, and parenthood related. Thanks for engaging and have a beautiful rest of the day!

Shape AI, before it shapes you!

As Field CDO at Dataiku, I assist C‚Äô levels in transitioning to large-scale, industrial AI deployment while making sure they use #AI #data creatively to reach their objectives. 
The intersection of Creativity and Technology fascinates me, particularly in Dance and Architecture. 

My background, combining tech, business, creative industries, and philosophy, has been very helpful in ensuring that AI does not replace me. With over 20 years of experience in change management, go-to-market, R&D, foresight, and digital across various sectors and regions, I have a unique perspective on moving from exploratory ideas and tech to scalable use cases that deliver business impact. With a background in political sciences, I enjoyed being on the board of Visit Britain during the Olympics and working as a French Trade Advisor (CCEF) in Berlin.
 
In 2023/24, I was delighted to bring WiDS (Women in Data Science) to Madrid and Dubai. Through the #Empower community I help ¬´¬†senior workers¬†¬ª (IE>50 üò≥ü©∂) to remain relevant to the job market through AI and data literacy. Finally I regularly collaborate with #STEM charities  to help teens to demystify tech through a 360 lens (geopolitics, philosophy, ROI‚Ä¶).
I was previously on the Board of the French Tech Berlin and the Mobile Marketing Association. I have been a visiting lecturer/coach at Esade, UCL, and ISEG - I am very excited to see how  #GenAI will challenge us in the teaching environment.

companydescription:
The ALT-EDIC, the Alliance for Language Technologies, was proposed in December 2023 as one of the first European Digital Infrastructure Consortium (EDIC). On 7 February 2024, the European Commission officially set up the ALT-EDIC with the Implementing Decision (EU) 2024/458.

Coordinated by France, the ALT-EDIC counts

- 17 Members States: Bulgaria, Croatia, Czech Republic, Denmark, Finland, France, Greece, Hungary, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Lithuania, Luxembourg, the Netherlands, Poland, Slovenia and Spain;

- 8 observing Member States or regions : Austria, Belgium, Estonia, Flanders, Malta, Portugal, Romania and Slovakia.

The mission of the ALT-EDIC is to develop a common European infrastructure in Language Technologies, focussing particularly on Large Language Models. It seeks to improve European competitiveness, increase the availability of European language data and uphold Europe‚Äôs linguistic diversity and cultural richness.

tagline: Associate Professor / AI Initiative Coordinator at ESCP.
summary:
Louis-David Benyayer is Associate Professor at ESCP Business School (Paris campus) and is the AI Initiatives Coordinator for the school. He is interested in the strategic implications of digital technologies, in particular big data and artificial intelligence. Recent research projects include data sharing business models, adoption drivers of Artificial Intelligence and Generative Artificial Intelligence.

His research has been published in scientific journals ; he has also written for the professional press (e.g. LSE Business Review, Les Echos) and for popular international organisations (e.g. World Economic Forum).

He has designed and launched academic programs in France and in the UAE and is currently developing new programs and content about Generative Artificial Intelligence.

Over the last 20 years, he has developed a strategy consultancy business working with large companies and SMEs. He has been involved in two start-ups and led a recovery plan for a bankrupt company.

He leverages his experience and network to develop customized training programs to support executives and organizations in the process of digital transformation.

He earned his PhD from the Dauphine University and his Master Degree from ESCP Business School.
skills: Entrepreneurship, Strategy, Management Consulting
jobtitle: Academic Director - AI for Business Certificate
companydescription:
ESCP Business School was founded in 1819, making it the world‚Äôs oldest business school. Throughout its 200-year history, ESCP has remained committed to educating accountable, bold and creative leaders who launch trends, bring new solutions and initiate the codes of tomorrow. 

ESCP‚Äôs six campuses in Berlin, London, Madrid, Paris, Turin and Warsaw are the stepping stones that allow students to experience ESCP‚Äôs European approach to management grounded in multiculturalism.

Every year, ESCP welcomes 11,000+ students and 6,000 managers from 136 different nationalities. Its strength lies in its many business training programmes, both general and specialised (Bachelor, Master, MBA, Executive MBA, PhD and Executive Education), all of which include a multi-campus experience.

With innovation as our cornerstone, we are accelerating academic research and business education to forge new pathways for a better future for all.

It all starts here.

ESCP is a multi-accredited business school with:
3 international accreditations: AACSB, EQUIS, EFMD
Programme (MBA/EMBA), 5 national accreditations: ACQUIN (Germany), QAA & Office for Students (U.-K.), CEFDG (France), recognised as a Foreign University in Italy by the Italian Ministry of Higher Education & Research. ESCP is also the first business school to become a full European University Association (EUA) member.

Are you interested in staying up-to-date on all the happenings at ESCP? Follow our showcase pages! Executive Education, Research & Impact, Blue Factory, ESCP Star, Jean-Baptiste Say, and many more . . . Find them all on the right-hand side of our profile.

tagline: Accelerating Science and Tech Communities with AI! üß¨‚öóÔ∏èüõ†ü§ùüåç Co-Founder & CEO at Just One Giant Lab (JOGL.io)
summary:
I‚Äôm a scientist turned entrepreneur, driven by the conviction that collaboration is the catalyst for breakthrough discovery. For the past 15 years, I‚Äôve been designing and scaling environments‚Äîboth physical and digital‚Äîthat empower communities to accelerate research, innovation, and impact.

In 2009, while pursuing my PhD in synthetic biology, I founded La Paillasse in Paris‚Äîone of the world‚Äôs first and most active biohackerspaces. It became a vibrant hub where curious minds explored biotech beyond institutional walls, reinforcing my belief in the transformative power of communities to generate knowledge and tackle global challenges.

As a synthetic biology enthusiast, I co-founded France‚Äôs first iGEM team (2007) and later PILI (2015), a pioneering biotech company producing sustainable, bioengineered dyes that replace petrochemicals. I also collaborated with the iGEM Foundation to expand its global reach, helping launch its Paris chapter.

In 2017, together with Marc Santolini and Leo Blondel, I co-founded Just One Giant Lab (JOGL), the first community-based open research institute. JOGL quickly became a platform for open science worldwide‚Äîits potential most visible during the COVID-19 pandemic, when thousands of contributors mobilized to co-develop open-source solutions against the crisis.

In 2023, alongside Louis Baudoin and Filip Vostatek, I co-launched the JOGL Company, transforming our non-profit platform into a scalable B2B SaaS solution that enables expert-driven collaboration across industries. The original NGO now continues as the JOGL Foundation, supporting open science and innovation through targeted programs and grants.

I remain passionate about building ecosystems where collaboration thrives‚Äîbecause I believe communities are the key to solving humanity‚Äôs most pressing challenges.
skills: Biotechnology, Genomics, Synthetic Biology
companydescription:
üöÄ JOGL aims to be the best operating system for science and innovation ecosystems. JOGL is an integrative digital platform that enables your ecosystem to collaborate more efficiently thanks to advanced community coordination, documentation, resource sharing and peer-reviewing features. It‚Äôs never been easier to bring your internal and external collaborators together, without recreating silos, and while keeping full control over privacy.

ü§ù We work with research institutes, companies‚Äô R&D, public agencies, higher education institutions, foundations, NGOs and decentralized communities to break the silos and reduce friction hindering scientific progress and innovation.

üåç JOGL is not just for institutions or businesses, scientists or engineers. JOGL is for anyone who seeks to build the best communities in their area of work and expertise.

üëâ Start organizing your ecosystem on JOGL now

companydescription:
The International Land and Forest Tenure Facility (Tenure Facility) is the first and only international, multi-stakeholder financial mechanism exclusively focused on securing land and forest rights for Indigenous Peoples and local communities. It provides grants to implement tenure rights under existing law and policy and shares the knowledge, innovations and tools that emerge. The Tenure Facility is dedicated to scaling up recognition of collective land and forest rights globally. This helps reduce conflict and further the achievement of global human rights, environment, and development goals. The Tenure Facility is an international foundation registered in Sweden. 
 
The Tenure Facility is supported by several donors, including the Swedish International Development Cooperation Agency (SIDA), the Norwegian Agency for Development Cooperation (NORAD), Good Energies Foundation, Mulago Foundation, the European Commission, Global Wildlife Conservation, and the Ford Foundation.

The direction de l'information l√©gale et administrative (DILA) is a central administration department of the Prime Minister's Office, placed under the authority of the Secretary General of the Government.

Its missions :

- LEGAL DISSEMINATION
DILA is responsible for publishing laws and decrees in the Journal Officiel de la R√©publique fran√ßaise (#JORF). It publishes and disseminates French legislative and regulatory texts on the L√©gifrance.gouv.fr legal access website. 
It publishes all legal, economic and financial information relating to public contracts, business life and associations (BODACC//BOAMP/BALO).

- ADMINISTRATIVE INFORMATION (individuals and companies)
DILA is the publisher of the official French administration website, service-public.fr and its professional version entreprendre.service-public.fr

- PUBLIC DEBATE & PUBLISHING
With the editions of La Documentation fran√ßaise, DILA is the preferred partner of more than 100 administrations and organisations. It also offers printing services to administrations.
A free information site on public life and current public debate, vie-publique.fr offers the keys to understanding public policies and the major debates that drive society.

tagline: I am a researcher-practitioner at the Learning Planet Institute in Paris.
summary:
I am a practioner-researcher working on open innovation and collective intelligence towards the Sustainable and Inner Development Goals.

I study how small and large groups innovate, collaborate and learn, with a particular focus on citizen science communities and the open-source movement. I hold a PhD in Statistical Physics from Ecole Normale Sup√©rieure Paris, where I studied Complex Systems Physics and Philosophy of Science. Fascinated by the emergence of higher-order simplicity out of complex interactions, I specialized in network science applied to biological, medical and social contexts at the Barabasi Lab in Boston, before becoming a research fellow at the Learning Planet Institute in the Learning Transitions Research Unit where I lead the Interaction Data Lab. I am also a co-founder of the Just One Giant Lab Foundation that supports the development of emergent, large-scale open research communities through social and digital technologies. My current research ties network approaches and participatory methods to foster collaborative dynamics and relational well-being in open innovation contexts. My work has been supported at the national (ANR), European (Horizon 2020), and international level (NESTA, Botnar Foundation).
skills: Open Science, Social Entrepreneurship, Citizen Science

- ADMINISTRATIVE INFORMATION (individuals and companies)

tagline: Engineering manager
summary:
Adding up, substracting are supposed to be basic operations, elementary even. Actually they are just the opposite. After transitioning from fossil energy substraction to additive manufacturing I can testify those two domains belong to what is now called deep tech. 

As tech and academia explorer I am confident that research can go further... by other means. And those means are expanding every day, broadening the conception range and making it reachable to most. They are not restricted  to big corporations or conventional research labs anymore. The goal is now to propagate, emulate and empower. 

My current missions #multitasking:

- Capturing the broadest prototyping tech panorama #technologicalintelligence
- Being able to zoom in on the most relevant technologies #expertise
- Passing it along #teaching #coaching
- Pilot the team skill improvement #strategy
- Bringing along decisive actors #networking #management
- Invest #publicprocurement

My future missions #prospective:

- Add up my competences by bridging digital fabrication, simulation and natural sciences #numericaltwin

tagline: CEO & Founder MusiXP | Former label executive @ Universal Music | Music Industry Expert
summary:
Expert in music strategy and business development with over 18 years of experience in the entertainment industry, including 9 years in management positions.

Former General Manager of labels at Universal Music, I signed and supported artists in their career development, led high-value projects, and built dynamic and effective teams. With expertise in digital transformation, business diversification, and the implementation of high-performing marketing and brand content strategies focused on acquisition and engagement, I stand out for my ability to blend creativity with business growth, opening up opportunities for innovation and partnership expansion.

I have demonstrated a proven ability to adapt in a constantly evolving ecosystem, achieving solid results.

Recent Executive Courses:
- Innovative brand and digital marketing strategies - insights from the luxury industry @ ESSEC (Executive certificate): Customer experience, omnichannel marketing
- Big data and artificial intelligence for business @ ESSEC (Executive certificate): AI, Big Data, IOT, Blockchain, GDPR, Python & R programming languages, data analysis

jobtitle: Enterprise Data & AI Platforms - Business Line Leader EMEA
companydescription:
Created in 2019, ChapsVision enables sectors with a strong Data footprint such as Retail, Finance, Public Services, to succeed in their digital transformation thanks to a highly complementary portfolio of fully integrated business solutions around a Unified Customer and Product repository and a modern platform for analysis and investigation.
ChapsVision now brings together the activities of Coheris, the historical leader in customer service, Octipas the unified commerce platform, NP6 the specialist in Customer Data Platform and Marketing Automation and Bertin IT, the specialist in Market and Speech Intelligence software solutions and digital investigation.
Through very significant R&D investments supplemented by a sustained strategy of acquisitions and international development, ChapsVision wishes to quickly form a coherent, important group, capable of becoming the privileged strategic partner of its Customers, by relying on its 15 years of expertise.

Les fonctionnaires de l‚ÄôAssembl√©e nationale, au nombre d‚Äôenviron 1300, sont recrut√©s par concours et exercent des m√©tiers tr√®s diversifi√©s. Dans le respect du principe de s√©paration des pouvoirs, leur statut autonome est fix√© par le Bureau de l‚ÄôAssembl√©e.

tagline: Director at AI Forensics - Investigating influential algorithms
summary:
Marc Faddoul is a transdisciplinary technologist, expert on recommender systems and algorithmic audit. He is the director and co-founder of AI Forensics, a digital-rights non-profit which investigates opaque and influential algorithms.

He has testified to the European Parliament, the French Senate, and is part of experts committees for the EU Commission, the French Digital Council (CNNum) and media regulator (ARCOM). He is regularly called upon to comment on AI and society by Washington Post, The Guardian, Le Monde and more.

Marc gained experience in algorithmic auditing in academia (UC Berkeley), big tech (Facebook AI), and start-ups (Bloom, Jalgos).
skills: Machine Learning, Cloud Computing, Semantic Web
companydescription:
AI Forensics (previously known as Tracking Exposed)
is a European non-profit that investigates influential and opaque algorithms. 

We hold major technology platforms accountable by conducting independent and high-profile technical investigations to uncover and expose the harms caused by their algorithms. 

Our innovative data-driven methodology provides journalists, researchers, and policymakers with timely evidence of systematic violations of users' interests and digital rights, particularly for minority groups and communities that are often overlooked in the design of technology. 

We develop our own auditing tools, which we release as free software to empower the research community, and strengthen the AI audit ecosystem. We believe that consistent and coordinated scrutiny is the path to restoring the balance of power between big tech platforms and its users.

We have 6 years of experience building free-software to investigate influential platforms and algorithms thanks to user-data donations. Our infrastructure has supported dozens of research projects and audits across multiple platforms (YouTube, TikTok, PornHub, Amazon, Glovo, Deliveroo‚Ä¶), leading to tangible impact in tech regulation and strategic litigations.
companyspecialties: Algorithmic Auditing, AI, Social Media, Responsible AI

companyname: BFA- Unit√© de Biologie Fonctionnelle et Adaptative
tagline: Bioinformatician ‚Ä¢ Evolution & Multi-Omics Data Scientist ‚Ä¢ Postdoctoral Research Associate [ CNRS & UPC ] ‚Ä¢ PhD Alumna [ UdeM ] ‚Ä¢ MSc Alumna [ Bordeaux U. & Harvard U. ]
summary:
‚Ä¢ Background & Expertise
I am a passionate bioinformatician dedicated to understanding fundamental biological questions through omics data science, computational systems biology, evolutionary biology, population and statistical genetics, and network biology-based strategies.

‚Ä¢ Research Interests
My computational approaches focus on developing unbiased and exploratory strategies to study the biology of both conventional and non-conventional model organisms across different omics levels, including genomes, transcriptomes, proteomes, and interactomes.
So far, I have worked on insects (fruit flies and the broader insect taxa), rodents (naked mole-rats and mice), budding yeast, and zebrafish. I also want to investigate complex traits, particularly aging and age-associated diseases.

‚Ä¢ My Vision of Science
With innovative and transversal strategies covering both computational and experimental approaches, I wish to contribute to a collaborative, open, and honest science. 
I strongly advocate for the use of FAIR (Findable, Accessible, Interoperable, and Reusable) data and emphasize the importance of method reproducibility in bioinformatics research. Additionally, I am committed to promoting bioinformatics and fostering a strong scientific community through science communication and outreach initiatives.

tagline: AI Policy & Governance
summary:
Raziye Buse √áetin is an AI researcher, consultant and creative. Her work revolves around ethics, impact, and governance of AI systems. She advises a range of organisations on understanding AI‚Äôs social impact from an intersectional perspective and implementing AI & data ethics/policy tools and processes. Buse builds bridges among research, advocacy, policymaking and arts communities at the intersection of emerging tech and its societal impact. 

Buse launched various projects with academia, industry, civil society members, community organisers and artists across Europe and the US to mitigate the harms of AI technologies and to enable equitable technological futures. Buse is the co-founder of AI research, advocacy and art platform Dreaming Beyond AI. Buse was in 100 Brilliant Women in ‚ÄúAI Ethics 2020‚Äù list and #35under35 European Leaders by ‚ÄúBarcelona Centre for International Affairs‚Äù. Buse has been a TedX speaker and was featured on Forbes. 

Feel free to get in touch for full-time/part-time/freelance opportunities, particularly interested in providing expertise working with technical and non-technical teams building Responsible AI tools and systems.
skills: Eƒüitim, Ekip Liderliƒüi, Digital Curation
companydescription:
AI Forensics (previously known as Tracking Exposed)
is a European non-profit that investigates influential and opaque algorithms. 

We hold major technology platforms accountable by conducting independent and high-profile technical investigations to uncover and expose the harms caused by their algorithms. 

Our innovative data-driven methodology provides journalists, researchers, and policymakers with timely evidence of systematic violations of users' interests and digital rights, particularly for minority groups and communities that are often overlooked in the design of technology. 

We develop our own auditing tools, which we release as free software to empower the research community, and strengthen the AI audit ecosystem. We believe that consistent and coordinated scrutiny is the path to restoring the balance of power between big tech platforms and its users.

We have 6 years of experience building free-software to investigate influential platforms and algorithms thanks to user-data donations. Our infrastructure has supported dozens of research projects and audits across multiple platforms (YouTube, TikTok, PornHub, Amazon, Glovo, Deliveroo‚Ä¶), leading to tangible impact in tech regulation and strategic litigations.

companydescription:
Digital technology is a societal issue and in particular for national education, combining territorial, national and international projects.
A young management with high added value, the Digital Education Department (DNE) defines the digital educational development policy, ensures its deployment and promotion.
Created in 2014, the digital for education department's mission is to drive and support the digital transformation of the education system for the benefit of the entire educational community (school staff, students, parents, communities, etc.) as well as officials of the administration.
It defines the strategic directions and the programming elements for digital education.
The Department coordinates the digital aspect of the activity of school education operators (CNED, CANOPE, ONISEP, etc.) and leads the partnership policy with public and private actors in the digital sector.
The digital department is also the animation of networks in the territory (academic digital educational delegations (DANE), information systems department (DSI) ...) and the management of national issues (exams, competitions, bank of resources, scholarships ...)
These challenges and projects, as rich as they are varied, bring together 1,162,850 staff and influence 12,858,550 students.

Bruno Schneider Le Saout is deeply invested in the field of innovation systems supplychains and digitization, particularly focusing on decentralized innovation, AI agents, and smart contracts. He emphasizes the importance of tokenization and IP automation in fostering open innovation. His work often involves leveraging distributed ledger and blockchain technologies to create more efficient and transparent systems for managing intangible assets and intellectual property.

Schneider Le Saout's approach to innovation systems is holistic, integrating various aspects of technology and business development to drive forward-thinking solutions. His contributions to the European Blocktech Federation and other initiatives highlight his commitment to advancing the ecosystem of decentralized innovation.

It's clear that he sees innovation systems as a crucial element in the future of technology and business, aiming to create more collaborative and efficient environments for growth and development.

At the forefront of blockchain innovation, his focus at Aurigraph.io as a Strategic Advisor is on guiding strategy and expanding our technological frontier. The last years have seen him contribute to advancements like a GDPR-compliant, high-throughput blockchain platform and fostering strategic partnerships in Europe and Asia. Leveraging over decades of research and experiments in decentralized innovation and decentralized artificial intelligence, he specializes in open innovation, intangible asset finance tokenization, and IP automation.

As Chairman of the European BlockTech Federation, he advocates for the strategic integration of regulatory intelligence in the financial sector‚Äîa testament to his commitment to shaping resilient, decentralized marketplaces. His contributions reflect a steadfast drive to harmonize technology with regulation, ensuring a balanced progression towards a data-driven economy that prioritizes trust and collaboration.
